QbEPSkixYGfIjRLfWnXabg.text: The pizza was awesome! Not to mention the service. When we got to the restaurant it looked pretty busy. The host sat us right away. Small place with delicious food. The crust was amazing!! Thin with  chewy soft sour dough edges. Cannot say enough. So happy we came! Thanks!!

ZoCpvLA1izfxa9JPPdYzQQ.text: Oh wow if you like Pizza like me your going to love this place! Franco Manca now have a few places around London and this great new location in Covent Garden is perfect! The restaurant is small but we managed to grab a table straight away, the whole place looked great and it had a great buzz to the place, you can sit and with a no logo beer which tasted great btw, i was pondering on what pizza to have as they all looked great on other tables, but i eventually decided on a sour dough Tomato, Cured organic chorizo (Dry & semi-dry) & mozzarella pizza, The pizza was tasty and fresh and at £6.95 a great price!!! Im now a fan of Franco Manca!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Franco Manca

yOyUeRfcdVA4buoD-iFtCQ.text: I had this pizza twice while I was in London! Once delivery and once sit in. Atmosphere is busy and fun and the service was great. All the pizza we got was delicious, especially the margherita! Sourdough base for the crust which is so yummy! Got seated quickly despite how busy it was and got out with the perfect amount of time to see our show!

Kwxm2OPcOYe9ITINQsmLtw.text: My friend took me here after sightseeing all day. Their pizzas are simply amazing! Fresh ingredients, thin crust, I couldn't have asked for more! The price was very reasonable.

aUFIW5PKyegSimkz-3MRfA.text: Yummy pizza for only $6-$7 euros. We got the #3 pizza it's enough for two people but a lot for one person. The service was good and we were seated right away.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Zucchini pizza

zkWPHMYGiZHVIa2JR0bjUQ.text: Looking for good pizza, all of the Franco Manca's have great reviews and a good reputation, so we tried it out. Long wait (about an hour) - expected to be honest, but they have an excellent reservation system, where you can check your spot in line via your smartphone browser!Food is quick and cheap. Hot fired oven pizza, though pretty well made. I actually thought our pizza was undercooked a bit, and a bit doughy in the middle, but overall it was quite good. While the menu is small everything is simple and well done. No frills.Service is great, because the turnover is so high, they are always around and moving quickly. For the price, this is a great value. For fairly cheap, good pizza, in a central location this is the place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom

BtKDKAZxYBE76525O_gECA.text: This place was recommended to me by several local people but I do not understand why. U.K Italian food is different than American-Italian. The pizza was just so different I did not love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom

x0S1domdIu9iTz0pqGUs0Q.text: Delicious, simple, well-cooked, sourdough pizza that is truly the best I've eaten in the UK! Great place to go on a cold night - just be prepared to queue as it is popular...and for good reason!

eadiFYBmBM3yBmirEsvsRA.text: This is one great pizza place just seconds from Covent Garden.While this is not my top favorite pizza in London, I must admit that the quality is really high.Pizza is also very inexpensive. Further, due to their sourdough base, the pizza has a unique taste to it, that distinguishes it from its competitors. Definitely recommended!

DlrSQMWZpNjt4dbrWbSSUQ.text: Good pizza but I never really understood the hype. Wholesome food although I wouldn't queue ages for it.

PDw0VJNdCFpvG0p-OXj60w.text: I'm a huge pizza lover, and wanted to try Franco Manca due to their good reputation. What I got was probably below what I was expecting; the pizza was really good size, but the toppings were incredibly sparse, even though I asked for extra. Maybe I just chose the wrong pizza or got a lazy waiter or something, but I just felt like there was something missing. The crust on my pizza was huge and slightly burnt too which didn't help. At their prices I think it was ok, but could have been so much better.

TPcC78cajy3yfZ3csC6Zhg.text: Yummy pizza for everyone!!!!  Get there early or wait but the wait is well worth it. Crust is thin. Slightly chewy and the toppings are Bueno!

3UD2IMC0vDRZgJApWGqVVw.text: Its delicious and the place is buzzing as ever! The size and the taste is bargain for the price its offered at in this part of London!

cpl9RAGaUKw-olmeWsQDKQ.text: Reasonably priced sourdough pie. I loved the sausage on mine, super tasty. Needed a ton of the chili oil and extra flavoring. Good service.

p53bVlb413m4a9nyITM7xw.text: Quality, cheap eat in Covent Garden!  Mainly pizza, but hey, they know how to do it really well.  Fresh and tasty ingredients used - I got the Veggie Special pizza of the day, which had extra pecorino cheese, yellow and red peppers, fresh rocket greens, and impressively tasty (pitted!) olives.  Not oily or greasy - fresh and light, if bready.  The end crust is quite bready - that's my jam, but not everyone's favorite type of pizza.  The crust/bread under the main part of the pizza though was quite thin.  A bit logistically difficult to navigate if you have a lot of toppings (to fold the pizza or not to fold...).Would have 5-ed for the food alone except that the service was very inattentive.  Getting a table to start with seemed disorganized (the hostess wasn't writing names down but trying to remember who to seat in which order... and wasn't always doing a great job with this).  The waiter did not read out the specials but told me to get up from my table and read the sign.  We were not asked how the food was during the course of the meal.  And finally, our waiter never gave us the check!  Had to wave the hostess down to get our check... like, did they want us pay or not?Clearly the place was very busy, and as long as we were proactive we got what we wanted, but definitely this place is understaffed for how popular it is.  The hostess explained that probably around 4 pm is the only time it's less busy.Anyways, we were happy with the bill -- 15 pounds for two pizzas and a bubbly water.  Quality, price, location, vibes of the restaurant all on point.  Service needs improving (hire another waiter or two!).

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. got it to go! in & out in 5 minutes :)
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. the vibe -- specials board in the back (hard to see if you're seated in the wrong place)
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. open style kitchen - smelling delicious!

oT4vLrVYhQ7ogMXAp3IjeA.text: Wow!!! What amazing pizza.  So worth the wait. Everything from the appetizer to pizza was extremely incredible.  Would love to have a chocolate pizza on the menu for dessert which could use some improvement. A great find in the neighborhood.

Qw6TjdbhSOrLFeGQh1MvVA.text: One of the best Pizza's in London. Fresh, delicious sourdough pizza's are always welcome in my world. Not much to say apart from TRY IT! You won't be disappointed.

pO-6v7n_TRPl-Kwa6eXDoQ.text: Outstanding meal and a great value. We had the "Franco & cantarelli grana, olives & mixed salad". Wonderfully fresh. Then the tomato, garlic and caper pizza. Delicious! Also enjoyed a bottle of their house wine. They've got two types of olive oil on the table - one has a cayenne pepper in it - it's hot but very good! Total bill was 36 pounds - a bargain for this quality and neighborhood.

hCrGZsbqjjJQlFdiUja_xA.text: For the price good tasting pizza and value for money. Also the ambience was rather nice. We had a table downstairs and felt roomy. Not many choices on the menu,  but that can make ur life a bit easier when chossing. House wine was below average but resolved with ibuprofen and aspirin this morning

v3CH8V6yi0UnsXrR2Pg1Bw.text: Very pleasantly surprised. In need of a quickish pit-stop lunch I happened on Franco Manca in Covent Garden. Tourist central so expectations relatively low. Service was quick, friendly and attentive. The pizza special was a 'meat special' which arrived at my table in less than 10 minutes. It was really very, very good. I'm not a fan of wafer thin pizza bread preferring mine on the doughy side and this didn't disappoint. The pizza base was piping hot, slightly crusty with that satisfying bulge around the rim to really get the teeth into. The topping was a number of different meat slices which, to be honest, was ok but the bread made it for me. Less than 10 quid and in and out in well under an hour. On the bookmarked list for future London jaunts.

CAe4kqRRn8OeeBlWChg4Uw.text: Delicious pizza for an affordable price. This casual pizza place is one of the best chains. Fresh, oven baked pizza with daily specials. I enjoyed the daily special featuring spicy lamb meatballs, mushrooms, cheese and basil. It was a satisfying meal. The only thing that was strange is pizza does not come pre-cut so you need to cut into slices or bite size pieces which are difficult with the butter knives at the table. Otherwise a solid meal for one.

29fsCb73KphCzPpOUczPww.text: My wife and I were on vacation and we had heard about this place on one of the cooking shows in America.We sat down and I got the 5 (TOMATO, GARLIC, OREGANO, CAPERS, OLIVES*,ANCHOVIES & MOZZARELLA £7.25) and my wife got the one (TOMATO, GARLIC & OREGANO £4.95)Great prices and the taste was fantastic! Super crispy, but fluffy crust and the anchovies and toppings were solid.I asked if we could return, but we had a lot of places to still try out.This is a must try though, plus, right around lots of cool stuff in the city!

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Margharita pizza and the number 5 with anchovies, capers, olives, light mozzarella.

lOUnjjKi9rEQDSuj7OPVnw.text: I might preface this by saying I'm not exactly a pizza personI ordered the chorizo pizza and it came relatively bare looking. My girlfriend ordered the tomato basil pizza and it also came pretty barebones. I was confused because it said tomato basil pizza and it came with a single piece of basil in the middle of the pizza. However, the chili oil, garlic oil, and olive oil in the middle of the tables really do add a lot to the pizza, I would be sure to add some to taste. All in all, the pizza was decent for the price. In terms of personal preference I would have preferred more substance (in the form of dough cheese toppings, etc), however that is mostly my fault for going to a thin crust sour dough pizza place.

jHh1uKH5aLxi81cGzH4CLA.text: Great place to sit near covent garden. Great prices, have great kids menu. Pizza very good, also had a salad, very good quality

XkAfppZfxW-M0sYKRkjwFw.text: Yum!  Delicious pizza for a good price.  We ordered the #6 and #7 and a bottle of Trebbiano wine.  The place was packed but we only had to wait 10 minutes for a table by the window.  Quick service and friendly staff.   If we lived in London this would be a regular spot for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom

WYoyPd__VwHEGZxnpKtiog.text: Great tasty pizza at really low prices. £6 for the basic pizza which is pretty filling, served quickly and super tasty. The beer selection is limited and not great but the house wines are really nice. If you like pizza (who doesn't?) treat yourself here.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Margarita with spicy lamb sausage (special topping, well worth it)

WOb5UsRq8MPOPmjChLIuTQ.text: I'm not a pizza person, at least that's what I used to think before I started studying the art of the neapolitan pizza for months. This place is the real deal. They use slow rise sourdough that had the right texture, taste, and chew that was baked in a wood fired oven. The chef even domed (raising the pizza to the top of the oven where the heat and smoke is) the final 5 seconds to give it that finishing touch. I ordered the most basic, cheapest (the best deal in my opinion), first item on the menu: Tomato, garlic, oregano 4.95 pounds. ($6.50ish). The tomato sauce was fresh and bright. The garlic wasn't burnt. The oregano came through. Make sure you drizzle with the chili oil or olive oil that are on the tables. I got mine take away and walked the streets of Soho with pizza box on one hand and a slice in the other. I walked by a homeless man and sat down with him to split the pie. Food tastes better when shared. That pizza was more than I could eat alone, yet I enjoyed every bite. In a world filled with mediocre to cardboard tasting pizzas, this is the epitome of what a pizza should be. I ordered a pizza oven for my backyard. I'm using this as a base to measure all my pizzas that I'll be making from scratch.

yfeChPTkBnQxPX-671PFVQ.text: Came here with a friend since this was a new happening pizza place. The place was super packed, and the pizza was alright but I am a New Yorker so my standards are kinda skewed. The prices were good and the service somewhat quick.

GZZdMQOtXnx3EirfgilrKQ.text: Decent price, but very limited choice of toppings. The crust is soft, which I wasn't expecting and didn't care for. I like mine to be crispy. The wine is nice and great price as well. We were also awkwardly rushed even though we had a full bottle of wine to finish and pizza left on our plates.. skip.

2HInSVwhg2SaXtcSbdqW-Q.text: Famed for their sourdough which gives their pizzas a unique taste, Franca Manca is basic yet pleasant. The menu is simplistic and rather limited in variety of both food and drink. Nevertheless, some additional toppings can be added to the pizzas and look out for their specials board for more savoury options, dessert possibilities and other extras. Helpfully, a non-cheese pizza can be chosen and personalised with your preferred toppings if you have a vegan or dairy-free diet.This branch of Franca Manca had efficient service, somewhat cramped seating, only one stall for a womens' toilet and had slightly burnt the rims of the pizza crust. The texture of the wild mushrooms tasted fresh, the tomato sauce juicy but the base too thin for my liking. Even the sharper knife design did not go unnoticed and was greatly appreciated as I find that pizzas can often be difficult to cut with an average blunt knife.All-in-all dining here was convenient and satisfying but nothing much to rave about.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate and hazelnut cake dessert with vanilla ice cream
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Gloucester old spot ham pizza
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Pizza with tomato, garlic, oregano, chorizo and wild mushrooms

i1vGlfi5PxP0fFFb1WJDqg.text: First of all the service is wonderful. The pizza was very tasty and the dough was amazing. The pizza options are limited but the options should please most everyone. The ingredients are top notch and the anchovies were excellent. The cost of a basic pizza is very reasonable at £6 to start. The homemade lemonade looked great and will have to try it. Will be back for sure. Only downside was no soda options.

KgeRofkwNzzAVM16hIcv9g.text: This was probably the best pizza I've had in a long time, service was quick and attentive and the pizza came out fairly quickly. Cost was very good and the beer was amazing! Would highly recommend just for the atmosphere and service, but that plus the amazing food made it a 5/5 experience. Highly recommend it to anyone who considers themselves a pizza lover.

VSn3RLGJUhznNKfQN4YNLg.text: I like pizza, but I don't like queues, or waiting around for ages outside...so I never bothered to visit Franco Manca, as they always seem to have a long line out the door. I mostly wear dresses or skirts, so my chilly legs ain't got no time for that! However, now they have been around for a while, the queue seems to have calmed down (at least on Monday nights- yay!)I looove:- The sourdough bases were perfect! I often leave the crust of my pizza if they are dry and boring...but I ate every crumb of this! Seriously...the crusts were crunchy, yet soft and doughy. They were even better drizzled in a little chilli oil. Yum.- They only have a few options for toppings, but both of the pizzas we tried were lovely.- The wine wasn't too pricey, but tasted good.- It is really affordable! £7ish for a huuuge pizza. Even with wine I spent less than £11!!This was better than ICCO. You can't get better pizza-praise than that. *I still wouldn't wait in line for an hour though!*

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. broccoli and sausage
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. olives, capers and anchovies

ZPFnt7a_VcYKE9QEmILMJg.text: Came on a weekday and it was fully packed had to wait for 5 mins to be seated. (Got one small table in the corner empty) since our table was in the corner I guess we were kinda forgotten by the servers. Waited for about 20 mins for the waiter to show up. You can basically make your own pizza here and add any number of toppings which are available. The pizza dough here is so soft and moist. I guess it's way different  than NYC PIZZA. I would not recommend this restaurant to someone who needs fancy decor or want to come on a date night as this place can get pretty noisy with so many people around. Loved the food but would not say their service was top notch.

Azv9EyzmA5gk7NFtzXQQlA.text: One of our favourite pizza places! This location is quite busy so if you don't fancy the wait, they do take away which you can order online or in person. Great simple menu with awesome bases, a great tasting pizza and enough to satisfy any pizza lover. The lemonade is great and the starter menu is a tasty treat before the pizza arrives.The prices are another great point about Franco Manca and whether you are grabbing a quick bite to eat or sitting down to really enjoy the evening, you won't have a big bill! The reason for the 4 stars and not 5 is that the service could be better. The first time we ate here, they forgot our starter, the next time they forgot our lemonades and another time, we made a mistake on our order which we quickly corrected with the waiter and if looks could kill....I would not be writing this review. It seems at some places it's fashionable to not care but a smile and excellent service goes a long way! Great pizza, great location, pay them a visit!

wvvRkDfSUYeJBnK0Hkyh4A.text: Pizzzzzza ! Money saver ALERT! valued pizza with big ass portion pizza, and only costs you approx. 6 pounds something! Service s speedy and staff are friendly. Menu is simple, good for those who cant make a decision on what to eat! lol . I thoroughly enjoyed the pizza no. 4, 5, 6... but the one with salted fish/ antichoke is a bit salty for my taste. Sourdough crust was easy to eat. me and my mates also ordered 3 ice cream. They are 2.5 pounds per scoop, but they do not have desert menu there, we have to ask the staff for it. They have raspberry, vanilla and chocolate, and they also have brownie and lemon cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Franco Manca - London, United Kingdom

r8_o3L8B12ZPHagRmJG6iA.text: Credit where it's due: Fantastic pizza. Amazing crust and overall delicious at a great price. But... they don't slice it and give you crappy butter knives. My MIL was struggling and the waitress wouldn't bring out a slicer or offer any help. Very strange... Also, they DO NOT OFFER VEGAN CHEESE. It came up in my search for vegan pizza and was the sole reason I chose this place for 5 people. That said, the pizza was still amazing so just know this going in. You'll need to order without cheese. Worth noting: very busy, extremely hot upstairs due to the ovens, and loud. Not great if bringing an older group along but probably fine for younger people.

NRfR2XHkNPc5wR2sWloBXw.text: Have been for first time with colleagues and really liked it, never been treated with such a great pizza, truly authentic! And since then have been couple of more times.

jBD95yDvaiKXtcJgfAJCvg.text: This is a must for families that LOVE pizza, esp thin crust!The dough and its Ingredients are fresh. They have regular cheese pizza but also irregular toppings such as chorizo or wild pig fennel salami. The wait on a Saturday night was 15mins. The restaurant is big enough to take groups. We are here for a week. We will probably visit 3-4x before we leave.
